title: The 'Roaring '20s' - The Fundamental Problem Of The Bullish View
text: While the idea of a "roaring ‘20s market" is undoubtedly optimistic, it is also a dangerous concept for investors to buy into.

title: Global Rally In Risk Assets Continued Last Week
text: VanEck Vectors International High Yield Bond increased 1.8%. The gain lifted the fund to another record high.

title: Former RBI Governor Rajan on Stimulus, Global Economy, India
text: Dec.07 -- Raghuram Rajan, former governor of Reserve Bank of India and professor of finance at University of Chicago Booth School of Business, discusses the need for more monetary stimulus as economies grapple with the pandemic, his outlook for the global economy and stimulus in China. He speaks exclusively on “Bloomberg Markets: China Open” from the sidelines of the Singapore FinTech Festival.

title: SPACs Sparkled In 2020, But What Lies Ahead For Them?
text: It might be hard in the midst of roaring markets and headlines trumpeting Dow 30,000 to remember that one of 2020's highest high-flyers has been the special purpose acquisition corporation, or SPAC. And SPAC initial public offerings (IPOs) keep on coming, bringing companies to market in what seems like a continuous spate of new listings.

title: Weak Day But No Topping (Technically Speaking For 12/7)
text: Despite record-setting highs, fund flows were modestly weak.

title: 2020 Financial Markets… the Worst & Best of Times
text: 2020… Worst of Times At the start of the new decade, markets are fraught with uncertainty: global economic growth looks poised to slow, forecast corporate earnings expectations are mixed, valuations are at all-time highs, and central bank accommodation has pushed credit spreads to cycle lows. Add the uncertainty of the U.S. presidential elections, equity correction […] The post 2020 Financial Markets… the Worst & Best of Times appeared first on See It Market.

title: Is Gold Signaling Coming Inflation?
text: The current market situation shows a quick attempt to push a smaller stimulus bill by the end of December before eviction protection and unemployment benefits end. If it fails to pass, it could potentially leave as many as 19 million people at risk of becoming evicted.

title: Market sentiment is at dot-com-bubble euphoria levels due to vaccine optimism, investor Peter Boockvar warns
text: Bleakley Advisory Group's Peter Boockvar said he believes market bullishness is at dangerous levels.

title: Report: Digital Lender SoFi Eyes IPO Via SPAC
text: Social Finance (SoFi), a San Francisco-based online lending startup, is holding talks about selling to a blank-check acquisition company, Reuters reported, to help it debut on the stock market. The news reveals CEO Anthony Noto's aspirations to go public after he succeeded SoFi Co-Founder Mike Cagney in 2018.

title: Market Recap: Monday December 7: Is the market overpriced?
text: Stocks regressed from record highs Monday as traders took a pause from an end-of-year rally. The Dow fell more than 100 points, or 0.5%, but was still held above the 30,000 level the index first exceeded in late November.

title: Jim Cramer: Return of individual investors changed the entire character of the market
text: "I think it's time to stop disrespecting the younger investors who've nailed 2020 every step of the way and start taking them seriously," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: China foreign minister pledges to uphold trade deal during Biden administration - US-China business council
text: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi assured U.S. executives during a videoconference on Sunday that Beijing remained committed to the Phase 1 trade deal with the United States, the head of the US-China Business Council said.

title: These Warning Signs Point to Overheating Stock Market Momentum
text: Stocks are rising on not very much news. Here's what to do about it.

title: Jim Cramer says young investors 'changed the entire character of the market'
text: "I think it's time to stop disrespecting the younger investors who've nailed 2020 every step of the way and start taking them seriously," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Stock futures fall as traders weigh stimulus prospects and increasing Covid-19 cases
text: Stock futures fell on Monday night as traders kept an eye on negotiations for additional fiscal stimulus while the U.S. coronavirus caseload continues to rise.

title: New M&A Cycle Just Beginning: Sullivan & Cromwell's Aquila
text: Dec.07 -- Frank Aquila, Sullivan & Cromwell's global head of M&A, sees a vibrant economy ahead which will set the stage for bidding wars. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: The Stock Market is Hitting New All-Time Highs
text: Despite everything that's been thrown our way, the Roaring 2020s are here. In this episode, Matt discusses some of the sectors leading the way, including the electric vehicles industry, which has exploded this year.

title: The Dow Fell 149 Points Because Fiscal Stimulus Is Already Getting Priced In
text: Stocks fell on Monday even as additional fiscal stimulus this year is getting closer to reality than fantasy.

title: Stocks fall as Covid-19 cases continue to rise in US
text: Alli McCartney, UBS private wealth management managing director and JJ Kinahan, TB Ameritrade chief market strategist, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss whether they are bullish on the markets and the economy. Kinahan also talks about what stocks TD clients sold, including Disney, Starbucks, and Bank of America.

title: IQ Capital's Keith Bliss discusses the impact of rising coronavirus cases on markets
text: Keith Bliss, IQ Capital managing partner and CEO, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the impact of lockdowns and additional covid restrictions in the markets.

title: Stock Market Today: Tesla, Tech Stay on Track, But Dow Dips
text: With little news on the stimulus front to lift investors' spirits, the "rotation trade" away from tech and toward more value-priced, cyclical equities took a breather Monday. Wall Street's attention was on America's still-worsening coronavirus outbreak, with the country nearing 200,000 new cases daily, and "the blip from Thanksgiving isn't even here yet," says Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation's top infectious-diseases official.

title: US Indexes Close Mostly Lower Monday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 30,069.79 on Monday with a loss of 148.47 points or -0.49%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,691.96 for a loss of 7.16 points or -0.19%.

title: Congress will try to buy more time for stimulus negotiations by voting on a one-week extension of government funding until December 18
text: Congress will vote on Wednesday on a one-week extension of to buy more time for coronavirus relief negotiations, according to House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer. "I am disappointed that we have not yet reached agreement on government funding," Hoyer, the chamber's number two Democrat, tweeted on Monday. "The House will vote on Wednesday on a one-week CR to keep government open while negotiations continue."

title: Why the market's lowest-quality stocks are embarking upon a rally that should extend for months, according to one Wall Street strategist
text: As the stock market continues to hope that a deal on a new stimulus is near, investors are showing more willingness to invest in lower quality stocks, according to CFRA's Sam Stovall. The chief investment strategist wrote in a Monday note that low quality stocks are set to rally for the next few months.

title: US stocks drop from record highs amid spiking virus cases
text: US stocks traded mostly lower on Monday and retreated from record highs set last week as a surge in COVID-19 cases led to new lockdown orders in California. With about 200,000 new cases reported each day in the country this month and with record numbers of cases reported in California, the state implemented new restrictions and stay-at-home orders affecting millions of residents over the weekend.

title: Dow snaps 4-session win streak and Nasdaq Composite logs 49th record closing high of 2020 amid COVID spike
text: U.S. stocks mostly ended lower Monday as worries about rising cases of COVID-19 weighed on investors' psyche, a session after all three major benchmarks booked all-time closing highs on the same day. New restrictions delivered a pause to the bullish investing mood, with social-distancing measures imposed in California.

title: One Potential Risk to Stocks: Fed Pulls Back on Stimulus
text: If the economy continues to strengthen, the Federal Reserve could reduce the size of its asset-purchasing program. In short, that would lift interest rates and pose a risk to stocks.

title: Water futures set to join likes of gold and oil and trade on Wall Street for first time ever
text: The CME Group is set to launch futures contracts tied to the spot price of water for the first time ever this week. The contracts will allow investors and farmers alike to bet on the future price of water. The contracts are tied to the $1.1 billion California spot water market.

title: Economic Growth: What To Do With The Workforce
text: At its height, the labor market lost 22 million jobs and many workers will not return to their old jobs regardless of how fast the economy recovers.

title: A New Volatility Index Offers An Expanded View Of Options
text: By Eric Leininger Thirty-day implied volatility is a liquid and sensitive part of the volatility surface and is closely watched by market participants. Traditionally it has been difficult to easily see 30-day implied volatility as options decay or drift towards maturity.

title: IPOs and SPACs go head to head: A year in review
text: Renaissance Capital Chairman and co-founder Kathleen Smith, Defiance ETFs President Paul Dellaquila and ETF Trends CIO Dave Nadig review IPOs and SPACs' big year with CNBC's Bob Pisani.

title: Are P/E's A Problem?
text: It is a fact that P/E's are sky high currently.

title: In One Chart: This chart shows how much of the stock market's 2020 moves can be attributed to COVID and the response to it
text: Analysts at Renaissance Macro take a look at the stock market's 2020 performance and break down the big drivers.

title: Investors should shift portfolios to 'leave-your-home' stocks, says Citi Private Bank CIO
text: David Bailin, Citi Private Bank chief investment officer, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss what investments could look like in a post-Covid world and how investors should shift their portfolios.

title: US CEOs expect to see a 1.9 percent GDP growth in 2021
text: The Business Roundtable 2020 fourth-quarter survey results are out. CNBC's Eamon Javers reports on what CEOs are expecting for the future and their economic outlook.

title: Big year for ETFs: Breaking down 2020's gains
text: Dave Nadig, chief investment officer and director of research at ETF Trends and ETF Database, analyzes exchange-traded funds' 2020 story and looks ahead to 2021. With CNBC's Bob Pisani.

title: In One Chart: ‘Smart money' stock-market index hits one-year low, as Nasdaq soars to records
text: Fresh all-time highs are making the smart money anxious on Wall Street.

title: China edges past Mexico as top US trade partner
text: China is again the top trading partner of the United States, with trade totaling $59.6 billion in October, according to data from the U.S. Census Bureau. China's total trade with the U.S. rose 25% in October compared to the same month a year ago, with imports from China increasing 14% and U.S. exports to China increasing 51%.

title: Exclusive: Online lender SoFi explores deal to go public - sources
text: Online lending startup Social Finance Inc (SoFi) has held discussions with blank-check acquisition companies about a deal that would allow it to debut in the stock market, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

title: Morgan Stanley takes some 'chips off the table' after emerging market surge
text: U.S. investment bank Morgan Stanley said on Monday it was taking "a few chips off the table" after a thundering rally in emerging markets over the last month.

title: Kara Swisher: There's a lot of appetite on Wall Street for new IPOs
text: Recode's Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to explain what the wave of IPOs coming at the end of 2020 means for the markets and the tech industry overall going into 2021.

title: Coronavirus vaccine to fuel faster economic recovery: Goldman Sachs
text: A “resilient” consumer and an imminent COVID-19 will propel the U.S. economy to faster growth than previously expected in 2021, according to Goldman Sachs Group.  .

title: Citi's 2021 Commodities Outlook: Futures in Focus
text: Dec.07 -- In today's “Futures in Focus,” Ed Morse, global head of commodity research at Citi, discusses his firm's 2021 commodities outlook, with a focus on China, copper and jet fuel. He speaks in today's “Futures in Focus” on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: Find out which companies are set to go public this month
text: Fox Business' Stuart Varney and Susan Li break down the upcoming IPOs for December. Subscribe to Fox Business!

title: Survey: Most U.S. Investors Expect 2021 Gains Over 5%
text: 77% are expecting U.S. equities to deliver more gains in the next 12 months, with two thirds of them expecting gains of 5% or more.

title: CEOs are much more upbeat about U.S. economy, survey finds
text: The CEOs of America's biggest companies are much more upbeat about the outlook for the U.S. economy, according to the latest quarterly survey released Monday.

title: These 4 technical indicators are pointing to a roaring stock market in the 1st half of 2021, according to BofA
text: Despite a rocky start to 2020 for stocks, the market has managed to claw back from its near 35% drawdown in late March and deliver year-to-date gains of nearly 15%, well above the average annual return of 8% for stocks dating back to 1928. According to a weekend note from Bank of America, the strong showing in stocks and above average returns in 2020 bodes well for further gains in the first half of 2021.

title: Hopes of Fresh Fiscal Stimulus Rise
text: Pre-market indexes are kicking off a fresh week of trading mostly in the red this morning, with the Dow -100 points, the S&P 500 -12 and the Nasdaq +3 points. This follows another strong week in the “Vaccine Rally,” whereby the first week of December has picked up where November had left us off: up, and strongly. We've set dozens of new all-time closing highs here in 2020, though today we're looking at market participants taking a breather.

title: The Stock Market: New Highs Ahead
text: The stock market continues to rise to new highs, even though the economy is weak, business failures and unemployment is high, and the pandemic continues to spread.

title: The Nasdaq Just Hit A Record High As Tech Stocks Book Gains Amid Tepid Market
text: Despite a lackluster performance in the weeks since the U.S. election, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is still up nearly 40% this year.
